issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When doAs=false, ATSHook should log the end username in ATS instead of logging the hiveserver2 user's name.
The way things are, it is not possible for an admin to identify which query is being run by which user. The end user information is already available in the HookContext.
fields.summary: ATSHook does not log the end user if doAs=false (it logs the hs2 server user)

comments.body:
The identification is fixed and the testing results show that this change works with Yarn ATS.

Thanks
-Rahman

[~ashettia] Thanks a lot for the patch and testing it out. The changes look good!
Can you please also mention if you had doAs=true/false in the above tests, and what you user you ran above 3 tests as ?

I have uploaded excel sheet called HIVE-9779-testing. It has all the details of the test cases. 

Thanks
-Rahman
